lexUnit.name: hiss.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a sharp sibilant sound as of the letter

sentence.text: Takeaway business was brisk and the espresso machine howled and hissed almost constantly for a steady traffic of hard-looking , fast-talking men with tattoos and torn jeans .
The air hissed slightly as the Tuthanach whirled slings .
At every third stroke he ran the brush over the teeth of the curry comb with a shimmering , rasping sound , hissing gently through his teeth all the time .
The gas lamp hissed gently above them and the coke stirred softly in the range .
Black steam-pipes criss-cross the 1,000 acres as they always have done , hissing here and there through open valves .
It will hiss and bubble like a cauldron .
Several young men hissed and whistled , much to Elaine 's delight .
The faceless ones knew the villain had been introduced and they wanted to hiss and boo .
The terminals in front of John hissed and sparked .
The rock hissed and cracked ; here and there a stone flew up , and the steam rose like smoke .
Once the machine was hissing and the aroma of coffee was spreading through the flat Rain tossed her bag on the couch , kicked off her sandals and opened the doors to the garden .
He raged at the futility of it , and shouted for help as his blade hissed and crunched , but his arms were tiring and he could feel blood running down inside his tunic .
The taffeta rustled as it received the pricking needle , hissed as she pulled the thread through ; out of sight pigeons chortled and cooed on the roof .
Somewhere below , angry serpents of stabilising jets hissed as automatics restored the balance .
Spectators booed and hissed as the colony 's new Governor -- former Tory Home Secretary David Waddington -- stepped forward to honour 24-year-old Diana Mitchell .
The steak was hissing in the frying pan and he was slicing Chinese leaf on the kitchen table when the doorbell rang .
Markby sat glowering at the gas fire which had dulled its bright flames and hissed in a soft insistent way .
But she did not answer him , only bent and lowered herself into the water , hissing as the coldness burned into the wound , a faint moan escaping through her gritted teeth as she began to wash .
It hisses like a snake , growls like a carnivore and snaps out at its tormenter .
He reached for the door control and the lock hissed with the release of compressed air .
He scrambled to his feet , throwing his cloak aside and hissing at the stiff pain of his collarbone .
Gesell hissed through his teeth .
He shifted his damp bottom and the planks hissed .
The light was hissing .
Vent valves along serpentine pipes hissed .
The robot 's loudspeaker crackled and hissed .
The song finished , and the loudspeakers just hissed .
